intro: Oenanthe subcallosa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved water dropwort, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in wet or moist habitats such as stream banks and marshes. It has a distinctive appearance with pale green, slender stems and umbels of white or pale yellow flowers. Oenanthe subcallosa is often found in temperate regions and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
